original_solution_mapping.L1: The total ratio representing the number of photos in the Malachi gallery is 10+17=<<10+17=27>>27
original_solution_mapping.L2: The difference in the ratios representing the number of photos Malachi took this year and last year is 17-10=<<17-10=7>>7.
original_solution_mapping.L3: This year, Malachi took 7/27*2430= <<7/27*2430=630>>630 more photos than he took last year.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4380.
    Returns: the number of more photos Malachi took this year than last year.
    """
    # L1
    ratio_last_year = 10 # ratio of 10:17
    ratio_this_year = 17 # ratio of 10:17
    total_ratio_parts = ratio_last_year + ratio_this_year

    # L2
    ratio_difference = ratio_this_year - ratio_last_year

    # L3
    total_photos = 2430 # 2430 photos in his gallery
    more_photos_this_year = (ratio_difference / total_ratio_parts) * total_photos

    # FA
    answer = more_photos_this_year
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The total ratio representing the number of photos in the Malachi gallery is {ratio_last_year}+{ratio_this_year}=<<{ratio_last_year}+{ratio_this_year}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts}

The difference in the ratios representing the number of photos Malachi took this year and last year is {ratio_this_year}-{ratio_last_year}=<<{ratio_this_year}-{ratio_last_year}={ratio_difference}>>{ratio_difference}.

This year, Malachi took {ratio_difference}/{total_ratio_parts}*{total_photos}= <<{ratio_difference}/{total_ratio_parts}*{total_photos}={more_photos_this_year}>>{more_photos_this_year} more photos than he took last year.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_ratio_parts' (27) was used instead of 'ratio_this_year' (17).
